Does this error occur when you use other JVMs? From the code, it appears to be 
the server timezone. Is it the same as your local timezone (Europe/Rome)? Could 
you perform the steps outlined below to reveal what is being sent from the 
server?

Create a file named ".options" in you eclipse directory (the directory that 
contains the executable) that contains the following 2 lines that enable CVS 
debugging. 
		org.eclipse.team.cvs.core/debug=true
		org.eclipse.team.cvs.core/cvsprotocol=true
		
Start Eclipse with the following parameters tailored to you local setup (The 
below example is for windows). The important aspects are the use of java.exe 
instead of javaw.exe and the inclusion of the -debug and -consolelog options. 
These will cause the debug console to be visible and for debugging output to 
appear in the console. 
		C:\eclipse\eclipse.exe
		   -vm C:\jre\bin\java.exe
		   -data C:\eclipse\workspace
		   -debug
		   -consolelog
		
Inside Eclipse, perform the operation that resulted in the error (probably 
checkout will do it). The CVS command traffic in the debug console should 
contains an invocation of the command that looks something like (this is output 
from dev.eclipse.org): 

   CMD> cvs co -d "org.eclipse.releng" -P -A "/org.eclipse.releng"
   ...
   Directory .
   /home/eclipse/
   co
   Clear-sticky org.eclipse.releng/
   /home/eclipse/org.eclipse.releng/

   392

I checked a couple of things with this info.
The method parseCustomTimeZone in TimeZone is called with "GMT-00:00" as
parameter. Here it computes gmtOffset as zero. Then the call to
ZoneInfoFile.getZoneInfo passing "GMT" return null.

I tryed to use tzselect to get the timezone for the "GMT" string and the msg is

`GMT' is not a conforming Posix time zone string.

But I'm not much confident this is a meaningful check.
Looking in /usr/share/zoneinfo there are several files called GMT.
The os is a debian 2.2

I'll try to get jdk _02 version to check with that.
I installed j2sdk 1.4.1_02 and everything works :)
Must have been a JDK problem
